**Source** [Player Core](/Sources.aspx?ID=216) pg. 357 2.0 **Traditions** [Arcane](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=1), [Occult](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=3) **Deities** [Atropos](/Deities.aspx?ID=533), [Bes](/Deities.aspx?ID=633), [Charg](/Deities.aspx?ID=594), [Desna](/Deities.aspx?ID=281), [Kagia](/Deities.aspx?ID=607), [Kitumu](/Deities.aspx?ID=677), [Luhar](/Deities.aspx?ID=679), [Radiant Prism](/Deities.aspx?ID=380), [Rhan-Tegoth](/Deities.aspx?ID=577), [Thremyr](/Deities.aspx?ID=497), [Vavaalrav](/Deities.aspx?ID=552), [Vudravati](/Deities.aspx?ID=359), [Zugero](/Deities.aspx?ID=509) **Lesson** [Lesson of Dreams](/Lessons.aspx?ID=16) **Patron Theme** [Paradox of Opposites](/Patrons.aspx?ID=25) **Range** 30 feet **Area** 5-foot burst **Defense** Will --- Each creature in the area becomes drowsy, possibly nodding off. A creature that falls [unconscious](/Conditions.aspx?ID=38) from this spell doesn't fall [prone](/Conditions.aspx?ID=31) or release what it's holding. This spell doesn't prevent creatures from waking up due to a successful Perception check, limiting its utility in combat. **Critical Success** The creature is unaffected.
**Success** The creature takes a –1 status penalty to Perception checks for 1 round.
**Failure** The creature falls unconscious. If it's still unconscious after 1 minute, it wakes up automatically.
**Critical Failure** The creature falls unconscious. If it's still unconscious after 1 hour, it wakes up automatically. --- **Heightened (4th)** The creatures fall unconscious for 1 round on a failure or 1 minute on a critical failure. They fall [prone](/Conditions.aspx?ID=31) and release what they're holding, and they can't attempt Perception checks to wake up. When the duration ends, the creature is sleeping normally instead of automatically waking up.
